name: Unit rates with ratios of fractions

skills.name: Use direct proportion to solve unitary missing amounts in problems (e.g. recipes)

explanations.A: 2/3 ÷ 1/5 = 2/3 × 5/1 which gives us 10/3. Converting to a mixed number gives us 3⅓ bags of seed needed for 1 acre.
explanations.B: It looks like you have done 1/5 ÷ 2/3 but you needed to do 2/3 ÷ 1/5
explanations.C: I think you have multiplied the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.D: I think you have added the fractions instead of dividing them.

explanations.A: I think you have multiplied the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.B: 3/4 ÷ 1/7 = 3/4 × 7/1 which gives us 21/4. Converting to a mixed number gives us 5¼ bags of fertilizer needed for 1 acre.
explanations.C: It looks like you have done 1/7 ÷ 3/4 but you needed to do 3/4 ÷ 1/7
explanations.D: I think you have added the fractions instead of dividing them.

explanations.A: I think you have added the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.B: I think you have multiplied the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.C: 1/4 ÷ 1/3 = 1/4 × 3/1 which gives us 3/4. So 3/4 pint of icing is needed per dozen cookies.
explanations.D: It looks like you have done 1/3 ÷ 1/4 but you needed to do 1/4 ÷ 1/3

explanations.A: I think you have multiplied the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.B: 1/3 ÷ 1/5 = 1/3 × 5/1 which gives us 5/3. So 5/3 pints of milk is needed per dozen pancakes.
explanations.C: It looks like you have done 1/5 ÷ 1/3 but you needed to do 1/3 ÷ 1/5
explanations.D: I think you have added the fractions instead of dividing them.

explanations.A: 2/7 ÷ 1/3 = 2/7 × 3/1 which gives us 6/7. So the tree grows 6/7 of an inch in 1 year.
explanations.B: It looks like you have done 1/3 ÷ 2/7 but you needed to do 2/7 ÷ 1/3
explanations.C: I think you have multiplied the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.D: I think you have added the fractions instead of dividing them.

explanations.A: It looks like you have done 1/4 ÷ 3/10 but you needed to do 3/10 ÷ 1/4
explanations.B: I think you have multiplied the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.C: I think you have added the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.D: 3/10 ÷ 1/4 = 3/10 × 4/1 which gives us 12/10. Converting to a mixed number gives us 1 2/10. So the sunflower grows 1 2/10 inches in 1 year.

explanations.A: It looks like you have done 3/4 ÷ 2/3 but you needed to do 2/3 ÷ 3/4
explanations.B: I think you have added the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.C: I think you have multiplied the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.D: 2/3 ÷ 3/4 = 2/3 × 4/3 which gives us 8/9. So 8/9 of a cup of sugar is used per teaspoon of vanilla.

explanations.A: I think you have multiplied the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.B: 3/4 ÷ 2/3 = 3/4 × 3/2 which gives us 9/8. Converting to a mixed number we get 1⅛. So 1⅛ cups of flour was used per cup of sugar.
explanations.C: It looks like you have done 2/3 ÷ 3/4 but you needed to do 3/4 ÷ 2/3
explanations.D: I think you have added the fractions instead of dividing them.

explanations.A: I think you have multiplied the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.B: 3/10 ÷ 4/5 = 3/10 × 5/4 which gives us 15/40. 15/40 simplifies to 3/8, so 3/8 of a gallon of water would be in 1 fully filled bucket.
explanations.C: I think you have added the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.D: It looks like you have done 4/5 ÷ 3/10 but you needed to do 3/10 ÷ 4/5

explanations.A: 5/9 ÷ 4/7 = 5/9 × 7/4 which gives us 35/36. So 35/36 of a gallon of water would be in 1 fully filled bucket.
explanations.B: It looks like you have done 4/7 ÷ 5/9 but you needed to do 5/9 ÷ 4/7
explanations.C: I think you have multiplied the fractions instead of dividing them.
explanations.D: I think you have added the fractions instead of dividing them.
